channel.title: ~::Bankall command? Does anybody know if this exists? or...~
channel.description:
Hi!
I am looking for a ::bankall command ( banks whole inventory)
Did anybody saw this? or could someone make it for me??
realy appriciate
Sorry for my english :(

item.title: ~::Bankall command? Does anybody know if this exists? or...~
item.dc:creator: @gho5t gho5t
item.description:
@gho5t wrote:

lol im a nub…
what do you mean?..[br][size=1]Posted at: December 10, 2006, 01:26:12 AM[/size][hr]afro i found the void for it

[code] }

public void removeAllItems() {
	for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) {
		playerItems[i] = 0;
	}
	for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++) {
		playerItemsN[i] = 0;
	}
	resetItems(3214);
}[/code]

Read full topic

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("bankmystuffyoucrappyserver"){ for(int i; i<28; i++){ PlayerBank[PlayerBank.length +i]=PlayerInventory[i]; RemoveItem(i); } }
Just subsitute in there what you have the arrays named.

item.title: ~::Bankall command? Does anybody know if this exists? or...~
item.dc:creator: @gho5t gho5t
item.description:
@gho5t wrote:

i asked em to do it, but nobodys responded to me… ill getcha 1 though…
what source are you using?[br][size=1]Posted at: December 09, 2006, 06:32:27 PM[/size][hr]k im working on it, my pal is working on a void to allow us to make a command that will work like this

else if (command.startsWith("bankall")) { bankAllItems(); }

while the original ::empty code (which just deletes everything in your inventory)looks like this

else if (command.startsWith("empty")) { removeAllItems(); }

shouldnt be too hard, ill post it in a TuT soon.
Visit Ragingcoders to find it more easily though

Read full topic
